skill.name: skill-creator
skill.description: Guide for creating effective skills. This skill should be used when users want to create a new skill (or update an existing skill) that extends Codex's capabilities with specialized knowledge, workflows, or tool integrations.
skill.summary: Guide for creating effective skills. This skill should be used when users want to create a new skill...
skill.author: openai

security_audit.summary: Official OpenAI Codex sample skill with safe, well-structured Python scripts for skill initialization, validation, and packaging. No network access, no external commands, no sensitive filesystem operations.

content.value_statement: Creating specialized AI agents requires a structured approach to knowledge management. This skill provides a complete framework for building, validating, and packaging modular skills that extend AI capabilities with domain-specific workflows, tools, and resources.
actual_capabilities: Initialize new skill directories with SKILL.md templates and resource folders
Validate skill structure, naming conventions, and YAML frontmatter requirements
Package skills into distributable .skill files (ZIP format)
Apply progressive disclosure design patterns for efficient context management
Organize bundled resources (scripts, references, assets) for optimal AI access
limitations: This skill provides guidance only; it does not execute on behalf of users
Skills are triggered by metadata (name + description), not by file extensions or paths
User must provide all domain expertise and content for their skills
No automatic testing of user-created scripts or resources

use_cases.title: Automate repetitive coding tasks
use_cases.description: Create skills that bundle workflow scripts, boilerplate templates, and domain-specific coding patterns for consistent code generation.

use_cases.title: Standardize team practices
use_cases.description: Build skills that encode company coding standards, review checklists, and deployment procedures for consistent team workflows.

use_cases.title: Share specialized knowledge
use_cases.description: Package domain expertise (schemas, APIs, business logic) into skills that help AI agents handle specialized queries accurately.

prompt_templates.title: Create basic skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new skill called [skill-name] in [output-path] with resources for scripts and references.

prompt_templates.title: Add skill resources
prompt_templates.prompt: Add [scripts|references|assets] directories to the [skill-name] skill and include example files.

prompt_templates.title: Validate skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Run validation on [skill-path] to check if the skill meets all requirements for packaging.

prompt_templates.title: Package skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Package the skill at [skill-path] into a .skill file and save it to [output-directory].

output_examples.input: Create a PDF processing skill in skills/public with scripts for PDF operations
output: Created SKILL.md with YAML frontmatter template

best_practices: Keep SKILL.md concise; move detailed reference material to separate files loaded on demand
Write clear triggering descriptions that explain exactly when to use the skill
Organize resources by domain or variant so AI loads only relevant context
anti_patterns: Adding README, INSTALLATION_GUIDE, or other auxiliary documentation files
Including vague triggering instructions like Use when needed without specific context
Putting everything in SKILL.md instead of using progressive disclosure with references

faq.question: Which platforms support this skill?
faq.answer: The skill creator is designed for Codex but skills created work on Codex, Claude, and Claude Code.

faq.question: What are the limits for skill names?
faq.answer: Skill names must be 64 characters or less using only lowercase letters, digits, and hyphens.

faq.question: How do I integrate skills with existing projects?
faq.answer: Skills are standalone packages. Place them in your skills directory and they activate based on name and description matching.

faq.question: Is my data safe when creating skills?
faq.answer: Yes. Skill creation scripts run locally, read and write only specified directories, and do not access network or environment variables.

faq.question: Why does validation fail on my skill?
faq.answer: Common issues: missing frontmatter, invalid YAML, disallowed keys in metadata, name with uppercase or special characters, or description over 1024 characters.

faq.question: How is this different from Claude projects?
faq.answer: Skills are modular, distributable packages with standardized structure. Projects are broader workspace configurations. Skills work across platforms; projects are tool-specific.
